history.content:
It's a little complicated.

In the past (pre-calcentral) choosing phase 1 would increase your chances but with the new enrollment system forcing students to drop off the lecture waitlist to be able to change lab or discussion choices, that advantage has disappeared.  

At this point, trying to sign up during phase 2 -- in fact waiting until after all undergrads have had their phase 2 appointment dates -- gives you as good or better chance than getting on the lecture waitlist during phase 1.

We hope that calcentral's functionality will improve but it's unlikely in time to be useful for SP17.

I'm a declared third-year psychology major and intended cog sci double major wanting to explore the possibility of also minoring in CS. I'm currently taking 61A but hoping to take 61B and 70 next semester... I was just wondering if anyone could clarify if I should phase 1 or phase 2 these classes in order to make sure I give myself the best chance to get in. What was written on the EECS website left me a little bit confused. Thanks in advance for the help.
history.subject: Lower div enrollment policies
